result.execSummary:
The defendant Joanna C Stacks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joanna C Stacks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joanna C Stacks was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply.   To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CS and MA.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: Concur to 16CM1539.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CS. Not use/possess any alcohol.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

RE: Bail Monitoring Arrest Warrant - body only.  Argument by Atty White and ADA Raymond; Bail set at $2,000 for the case; Defendant not be at the  900 block of Magnolia Lane, Madison, WI; $500 cash bond previosuly posted to be applied; all other conditions previously set remain the same.

Cash Bail - $2,000.    $500 cash - previously posted:  
- The court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in court.  Cash bond is set in the amount of $500.  If the defendant posts cash bail, she must report to and comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM) as a condition of her release.  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00AM on the business day following her release from jail.
- Defendant shall have no contact, direct or indirect, with Crystal S. or Markeisha A.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not be at the 900 block of Magnolia Lane, Madison, Wisconsin.
- If the Defendant has any further violations of bail conditions, a body-only warrant be issued for any further non-compliance.
